text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Matsuda was born on 26 October 1966. She played for Prima Ham FC Kunoichi. On 6 September 1981, when Matsuda was 15 years old, she debuted for the Japan national team against England. She played at 1986, 1989, 1991 AFC Championship and 1990 Asian Games. She was also a member of Japan for 1991 World Cup. This competition was her last game for Japan. She played 45 games and scored 10 goals for Japan until 1991. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1981 1 0 1982 0 0 1983 0 0 1984 3 2 1985 0 0 1986 10 3 1987 4 0 1988 2 0 1989 9 1 1990 5 2 1991 11 2 Total 45 10 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese footballers Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Iga FC Kunoichi Mie players Category:1991 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1986 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1989 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1991 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1990 Asian Games
title: Michiko Matsuda
